linuxFiles./usr/share/upstart: init file that exists in Upstart init implementations
linuxFiles./lib: holds library files that binaries can use
linuxFiles./var/log/messages: general log file that holds all non-critical and non-debug messages from bottupm authm cron etc.
linuxFiles.poweroff.target: shutdown system goal file for systemd
linuxFiles./etc/resolv.conf: file used to map DNS servers for more effecient lookups..ulitmately made irrelevant due to improvements to DNS
linuxFiles./etc/fstab: short for file system table and holds permanent list of mounted filesystems
linuxFiles./etc/logrotate.d: log file utility that decides what logs to keep..how many..and how to compress
linuxFiles./etc/exports: list of directories that can be exported automatically by an NFS server
linuxFiles.Btrfs filesystem: high performance journaling file system... great for system with large files
linuxFiles./etc/syslog.d: keeps config details of what files are maintained in syslog for output
linuxFiles./etc/apt/sources.list: list of preapproved sources to get packages from on debian
linuxFiles./bin: ready to run programs (binaries) are stored here
linuxFiles./etc/sudoers: list of users who can run sudo
linuxFiles./boot/grub/grub.conf or /etc/grub.conf: grub config file contains kernel and initrd image
linuxFiles./etc/hosts: file that contains mappings of hostnames to IP addresses where hosts look first for IP address mappings
linuxFiles.initrd: temp file system used before loading the kernel
linuxFiles./var/logkern.log: log file that logs the kernel info and events on your system
linuxFiles./var: variable directory used for system logging..user tracking..caches etc
linuxFiles./usr: does not contain user files meant for installed software and ultities
linuxFiles..service: service units...services we've been starting and stopping in systemd
linuxFiles.sysfs: virtual file system mounted to /sys used to view info and manage devices including info about manufacturer.. model..where it is plugged in..state..heirarchy..just manage devices here not like /dev
linuxFiles.ext4 filesystem: most current version of linux filesystem
linuxFiles./etc/shadow: like passwd except it shows encrypted password and password info..means for authentication and pluggable authenticaion modules (PAM)
linuxFiles./etc: core system configuration directory..only holds config files and no binaries
linuxFiles.muli-user.target: mulit-user with networking goal file for systemd
linuxFiles./dev/zero: device that accepts and discards all input... produces stream of NULL bytes
linuxFiles./etc/hosts.allow: file for host mappings that can be accessed
linuxFiles.default.target: defualt boot goal for systemd normally graphical.target
linuxFiles.Kernel: core of the OS with three layer of abstraction
linuxFiles./dev/hda: first PATA device found on older systems
linuxFiles./etc/init: in Upstart implementations shows list of jobs
linuxFiles./srv: site specific data which are served by the system
linuxFiles./dev/hdd2: second partition on fourth PATA disk
linuxFiles./etc/passwd: lists users including:..username..password..userID..groupID..GECOS field(csv comments)..users home dir and users shell..all users not just human modify with vipw
linuxFiles.lib/modules/(kernel version)/kernel/driv: file where kernel module drivers are
linuxFiles./var/log/syslog: output of syslog which shows event messages that occur
linuxFiles./etc/network/interfaces: file that holds information for all network interfaces
linuxFiles./sbin: contains essential system binaries.... can only be run by root
linuxFiles./var/log/dmesg: log file that shows info about hardware drivers .. kernel info and status during bootup and more
linuxFiles./usr/lib/systemd: init file that exists in Systemd init implementations
linuxFiles./etc/group: file with groups and different permissions
linuxFiles./etc/rc: shell program that looks to mount remote directories to local VFS on boot
linuxFiles./proc filesystem: how the kernel views the system all process information is stored here
linuxFiles.system.map: symbolic lookup table for the kernel
linuxFiles./etc/initab: init file that exists in System V init implementations
linuxFiles.usr/local: local directory for variety of config and binaries
linuxFiles.grphical.target: mulituser with networking and GUI goal file for systemd
linuxFiles./etc/hosts.deny: file for host mappings that cannot be accessed
linuxFiles./media: used as attachment point for removable media like usb drives
linuxFiles.rescue.target: single user mode goal file for systemd
linuxFiles.dhclient.conf: file that DHCP gets list of netowrk interfaces from
linuxFiles./var/log/auth.log: log file that contains auth logs like user logins and authentication used
linuxFiles./proc/cpuinfo: file where we store cpu information including number of cores
linuxFiles.dhclient.leases: file that DHCP uses to keep track of leases across system reboots
linuxFiles./dev/null: device that accepts and discards all input produces no output
linuxFiles./run: info about running systems since last boot
linuxFiles.vfs filesystem: abstraction layer that allows for different types of file systems to work with all applications
